WRITING.TEXT: Being an arrogant twat would be saying someones sense of humor is juvenile without putting the context of the joke into your example. I have given you good examples to refute all your claims, not vice versa. You just blatantly said that people that enjoy any comedy film with Jack Black, Jim Carrey, etc. have the sense of humor of a six year old.

You have been completely writing off multiple films and actors as a whole with little to no information about the films or understanding of the jokes you used as examples. I never said you cant have an opinion but obviously im going to argue against it when you make insanely bold claims. But thank you for insulting me during a civil debate.

The scene isnt funny because hes talking out of his ass, its the fact that a grown man in a professional setting would do that and expect to be taken seriously. The comedy of that also comes from the fact that he is clearly an idiotic manchild, but is extremely talented at being a pet detective and manages to get the job done. Thats the point of Ace Ventura and for you to completely miss that point is why I think you don't understand comedy, or just refuse to be open minded. Mr.Bean is also the definition of over the top stupid comedy, yet hes your favourite comedy actor? Even if you say youre not a particular fan of that, how can you discount someone like Jack Black in Bernie just because you didnt like him in School of Rock? I also dont enjoy "dreck" because I like some of the most popular comedies of all time. I feel like the only comedy you enjoy is the stuff that allows you to lord your intelligence and wit over others, while misjudging all other forms. Believe me, there are tons of shitty comedy movies, I could list a ton, but movies like School of Rock, Austin Powers, The Mask, Tommy Boy, etc are not among them.

It seems your grasp of what comedy is is.... Loose, if you think that all of those Jim Carrey movies are just him shouting and doing stupid stuff. Out of curiosity, what comedy actors do you like then? Also Jim Carrey still does his regular schtick in The Truman Show, and is quite funny in it outside of the drama.
Litchrally!

I'm not saying that's not all that comedy is, but to deny that a lot of good comedy roles are over the top is straight up incorrect. Jim Carrey does over the top great, as does Jack Black, as does Eddie Murphy (for the most part), as did Chris Farley, as does Mike Myers often, etc. You can't say none of these people are good actors can you?

I have seen over the top characters done very poorly, Dewey Finn is an example of the opposite, as is his character in Tropic Thunder. He definitely does more than make faces. To say over the top takes no talent is absurd, haven't you ever heard how many actors say comedy is harder than drama? You didn't even acknowledge his acting in movies like Bernie. Also School of Rock is a near perfect family film that also works well for adults, done by one of the greatest directors working today.

Jack Black has many good non goofy roles like Bernie, The D Train, and The Holiday. He's also one of the best at playing over the top characters as seen in Tropic Thunder and School of Rock. I think you're judging a little harshly. Also I'm not even a huge Kevin Hart fan but to judge him for being in Scary Movie 3 (good) and 4 (not that bad) before he was famous is ridiculous.
You never have had a Treatza Pizza from Dairy Queen? Shit is great.
